column2: ENGLISH
A Tribute of Gold?

[FromFrom.GetTitledName] has sent an envoy bringing with him a tribute of gold.\n\nAccepting the tribute would give [FromFrom.GetTitledName] some Grace, which [FromFrom.GetSheHe] might use to request a Boon in the future, but refusing without a good reason would be a widely unpopular move.
I sure love gold!
Gold is nice, I guess...
I suppose I should accept it...
The Dragon Throne does not acknowledge the envoy, for a good reason!
The Dragon Throne does not acknowledge the envoy, because I said so!
The Dragon Throne accepts your gift, and wishes to let you know that gold is a particularly welcome gift.
The Dragon Throne accepts your gift. Gold is neither particularly welcome nor particularly unwelcome.
The Dragon Throne accepts your gift, but wishes to let you know that gold is not particularly needed at the moment
Perhaps I should send more gold...?
As would be expected
I suppose other tributes might be better...
The Dragon Throne refuses your paltry gift and has no interest in associating with people such as you.
I shall remember this insult!
A New Tributary?

[FromFrom.GetTitledName] has sent an envoy to offer [FromFrom.GetHerHis] submission to the Dragon Throne as a tributary.\n\nAccepting the tribute would give [FromFrom.GetTitledName] some Grace, which [FromFrom.GetSheHe] might use to request a Boon in the future, but refusing without a good reason would be a widely unpopular move.
Of course the [FromFrom.PrimaryTitle.GetName] should be my tributary!
The Dragon Throne does not acknowledge the envoy, for a good reason!
The Dragon Throne does not acknowledge the envoy, because I said so!
The Dragon Throne accepts your request to become a tributary.
As would be expected!
The Dragon Throne has deemed you unworthy of becoming a tributary.
I shall remember this insult!
A Tribute of Horses?

[FromFrom.GetTitledName] has sent an envoy with an offer to supply the Dragon Throne with horses.\n\nAccepting the tribute would give [FromFrom.GetTitledName] some Grace now and some monthly Grace gain, which [FromFrom.GetSheHe] might use to request a Boon in the future, but refusing without a good reason would be a widely unpopular move.
The armies of the Middle Kingdom could always use more horses!
The Dragon Throne does not acknowledge the envoy, for a good reason!
The Dragon Throne does not acknowledge the envoy, because I said so!
The Dragon Throne accepts your offer to supply horses.
A profitable agreement!
The Dragon Throne has no interest in your horses.
I shall remember this insult!
No More Horses
[FromFrom.GetTitledName] has sent an envoy to inform you that [FromFrom.GetSheHe] will no longer be supplying the Middle Kingdom with horses.
I shall remember this insult!
The Dragon Throne will remember that you broke your agreement to supply horses. You might find it harder to receive Boons in the future.
I suppose I can see why [From.GetBestName] is upset...
A Eunuch for China?

[FromFrom.GetTitledName] has sent an envoy bringing with him a eunuch, [FromFromFrom.GetFullName], as a tribute.\n\nAccepting the tribute would give [FromFrom.GetTitledName] some Grace, which [FromFrom.GetSheHe] might use to request a Boon in the future, but refusing without a good reason would be a widely unpopular move.
I could use another eunuch!
My vassal could use a eunuch!
The Dragon Throne does not acknowledge the envoy, for a good reason!
The Dragon Throne does not acknowledge the envoy, because I said so!
The Dragon Throne accepts the eunuch you sent, and will keep him at court.
I hope they find a use for him!
The Dragon Throne accepts the eunuch you sent, but [From.GetTitledName] has seen fit to give him to a vassal instead of keeping him at court.
That is not what I had in mind...
The Dragon Throne has no need for your eunuch.
[FromFromFromFrom.GetFirstName] will probably be a bit upset...
A Concubine for China?

[FromFrom.GetTitledName] has sent an envoy bringing with him [FromFromFrom.GetFullName], who is being offered as a concubine.\n\nAccepting the tribute would give [FromFrom.GetTitledName] some Grace, which [FromFrom.GetSheHe] might use to request a Boon in the future, but refusing without a good reason would be a widely unpopular move.
I could always use another concubine!
My heir could always use another concubine!
My vassal could always use a concubine!
The Dragon Throne does not acknowledge the envoy, for a good reason!
The Dragon Throne does not acknowledge the envoy, because I said so!
The Dragon Throne accepts your concubine. [From.GetBestName] will keep her as his personal concubine.
Just as planned.
The Dragon Throne accepts your concubine. [From.GetBestName] will give her to [FromGetHerHis] heir.
That's fair enough.
The Dragon Throne accepts your concubine. [From.GetBestName] has seen fit to give her to one of [From.GetHerHis] vassals.
That's not what I wanted!
The Dragon Throne has no intention to accept a concubine from you.
How dare [From.GetBestName]?
A New Commander?

[FromFrom.GetTitledName] has sent an envoy bringing with him [FromFromFrom.GetFullName], offering [FromFromFrom.GetHerHim] as a commander.\n\nAccepting the tribute would give [FromFrom.GetTitledName] some Grace, which [FromFrom.GetSheHe] might use to request a Boon in the future, but refusing without a good reason would be a widely unpopular move.
I could use another commander!
My vassal could use another commander!
The Dragon Throne does not acknowledge the envoy, for a good reason!
The Dragon Throne does not acknowledge the envoy, because I said so!
The Dragon Throne accepts your commander, and will keep [FromFromFromFrom.GetHerHim] at court.
As I expected!
The Dragon Throne accepts your commander, but will give [FromFromFromFrom.GetHerHim] to a vassal.
Not what I wanted to hear...
The Dragon Throne has no interest in accepting a commander from you.
Fine! I will keep my commander!
A New Physician?

[FromFrom.GetTitledName] name has sent an envoy bringing with him [FromFromFrom.GetFullName], offering [FromFromFrom.GetHerHim] as a physician.\n\nAccepting the tribute would give [FromFrom.GetTitledName] some Grace, which [FromFrom.GetSheHe] might use to request a Boon in the future, but refusing without a good reason would be a widely unpopular move.
I could use a new physician!
My vassal could use a new physician!
The Dragon Throne does not acknowledge the envoy, for a good reason!
The Dragon Throne does not acknowledge the envoy, because I said so!
The Dragon Throne accepts your physician, and will keep [FromFromFromFrom.GetHerHim] at court.
As I expected!
The Dragon Throne accepts your physician, but will give [FromFromFromFrom.GetHerHim] to a vassal.
Not what I wanted to hear...
The Dragon Throne has no interest in accepting a physician from you.
Fine! I will keep my physician!
Relief for China?

[FromFrom.GetTitledName] has sent an envoy bringing with him an offer to send relief to alleviate the current strain on the population of the Middle Kingdom.\n\nAccepting the relief would give [FromFrom.GetTitledName] some Grace, which [FromFrom.GetSheHe] might use to request a Boon in the future, but refusing without a good reason would be a widely unpopular move.
We could certainly use the relief!
The Dragon Throne does not acknowledge the envoy, for a good reason!
The Dragon Throne does not acknowledge the envoy, because I said so!
The Dragon Throne accepts your offer of relief. All help in this time of need is appreciated.
As would be expected!
The Dragon Throne will not accept relief from you.
I shall remember this insult!
A New Artifact?

[FromFrom.GetTitledName] has send an envoy bringing with him [FromFromFrom.GetBaseName] and offers it as a gift to the Dragon Throne.\n\nAccepting the tribute would give [FromFrom.GetTitledName] some Grace, which [FromFrom.GetSheHe] might use to request a Boon in the future, but refusing without a good reason would be a widely unpopular move.
I will accept the artifact!
I will give the artifact to my vassal!
The Dragon Throne does not acknowledge the envoy, for a good reason!
The Dragon Throne does not acknowledge the envoy, because I said so!
The Dragon Throne accepts the artifact you sent. It will be added to [From.GetTitledName]'s personal collection.
As I expected!
The Dragon Throne has seen fit to accept your artifact, but it will be given to a vassal.
That's not quite what I wanted...
The Dragon Throne has no interest in your baubles.
Then I shall put it to better use!
Peace for our time?

[FromFrom.GetTitledName] has sent an envoy asking for an official Peace Deal between the [FromFrom.PrimaryTitle.GetName] and the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] as [FromFrom.GetSheHe] has earned enough Grace to request this Boon.\n\nRefusing the Boon without a good reason would be a widely unpopular move.
Of course we will sign such a treaty!
The Dragon Throne does not acknowledge the envoy, for a good reason!
The Dragon Throne does not acknowledge the envoy, because I said so!

The Dragon Throne is in agreement. A Peace Deal has been signed between the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] and the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName], lasting for fifty years or until the [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] no longer sits on the Dragon Throne.
Great news!
The Dragon Throne has no intention of agreeing to a Peace Deal with barbarians like [Root.GetTitledName].
I will not forget this!
Send a Physician?

[FromFrom.GetTitledName] has sent an envoy asking you for a physician as [FromFrom.GetSheHe] has earned enough Grace to request this Boon.\n\nRefusing the Boon without a good reason would be a widely unpopular move.
A physician will be sent!
The Dragon Throne does not acknowledge the envoy, for a good reason!
The Dragon Throne does not acknowledge the envoy, because I said so!
The Dragon Throne has dispatched [chinese_doctor.GetBestName] to serve as your Court Physician.
[chinese_doctor.GetSheHeCap] will serve me well!
The Dragon Throne will not waste the talents of the Middle Kingdom's physicians on barbarians like [Root.GetTitledName].
I will not forget this!
Send an Artifact?

[FromFrom.GetTitledName] has sent an envoy asking for a Chinese artifact as [FromFrom.GetSheHe] has earned enough Grace to request this Boon.\n\nRefusing the Boon without a good reason would be a widely unpopular move.
I will send a plain artifact!
I will send a good artifact!
I will send the finest artifact possible!
The Dragon Throne does not acknowledge the envoy, for a good reason!
The Dragon Throne does not acknowledge the envoy, because I said so!
How plain do you wish for the artifact to be sent to [FromFromFrom.GetTitledName] to be?
The simplest possible artifact will do.
A bit less plain than the bare minimum.
Which artifact do you wish to send to [FromFromFromFrom.GetTitledName]?
A Painting of Shanguang Tí!
A Small Figurine!
The Dragon Throne has seen fit to grant you a Painting of Shanguang Tí.
The Dragon Throne has seen fit to grant you a Small Figurine.
That's not as majestic as I had hoped...
Which artifact do you wish to send to [FromFromFromFrom.GetTitledName]?
A Chinese Arm Protector!
A Serpent Spear!
A Tapestry Depicting Trade!
Something else
A Chinese Artwork!
Some Chinese Calligraphy!
A Chinese Sculpture!
The Dragon Throne has seen fit to grant you a Chinese Arm Protector.
The Dragon Throne has seen fit to grant you a Serpent Spear.
The Dragon Throne has seen fit to grant you a Tapestry Depicting Trade.
The Dragon Throne has seen fit to grant you a Chinese Artwork.
The Dragon Throne has seen fit to grant you some Chinese Calligraphy.
The Dragon Throne has seen fit to grant you a Chinese Sculpture.
Plain, but sensible, I guess...
How grand do you wish for the artifact to be sent to [FromFromFrom.GetTitledName] to be?
Neither grand nor plain
A bit on the grand side
Which artifact do you wish to send to [FromFromFromFrom.GetTitledName]?
A Silk Shroud!
A Grand Tapestry!
A Ji!
Something else
A Zhuge Crossbow!
A Bronze Sculpture!
Some Ceremonial Robes!
The Dragon Throne has seen fit to grant you a Silk Shroud.
The Dragon Throne has seen fit to grant you a Grand Tapestry.
The Dragon Throne has seen fit to grant you a Ji.
The Dragon Throne has seen fit to grant you a Zhuge Crossbow.
The Dragon Throne has seen fit to grant you a Bronze Sculpture.
The Dragon Throne has seen fit to grant you some Ceremonial Robes.
That's quite nice!
Which artifact do you wish to send to [FromFromFromFrom.GetTitledName]?
A Water Clock!
A Jian!
A Dragon Amulet!
The Dragon Throne has seen fit to grant you a Water Clock.
The Dragon Throne has seen fit to grant you a Jian.
The Dragon Throne has seen fit to grant you a Dragon Amulet.
The [From.GetTitle] of the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] is generous indeed!
The Dragon Throne has seen fit to grant you a Jade Dragon.
This is indeed a grand gift!
The Dragon Throne will not give any artifact from the Middle Kingdom to barbarians like [Root.GetTitledName].
I will not forget this!
Send a Siege Engineer?

[FromFrom.GetTitledName] has sent an envoy asking for a siege engineer as [FromFrom.GetSheHe] has earned enough Grace to request this Boon.\n\nRefusing the Boon without a good reason would be a widely unpopular move.
A siege engineer will be sent!
The Dragon Throne does not acknowledge the envoy, for a good reason!
The Dragon Throne does not acknowledge the envoy, because I said so!
The Dragon Throne has dispatched [chinese_siege_engineer.GetBestName] to serve you as a siege engineer.
[chinese_siege_engineer.GetSheHeCap] will serve me well!
The Dragon Throne will not waste the talents of the Middle Kingdom's siege engineers on barbarians like [Root.GetTitledName].
I will not forget this!
Send a Strategist?

[FromFrom.GetTitledName] has sent an envoy asking for a strategist as [FromFrom.GetSheHe] has earned enough Grace to request this Boon.\n\nRefusing the Boon without a good reason would be a widely unpopular move.
A strategist will be sent!
The Dragon Throne does not acknowledge the envoy, for a good reason!
The Dragon Throne does not acknowledge the envoy, because I said so!
The Dragon Throne has dispatched [chinese_strategist.GetBestName] to serve you as a strategist.
[chinese_strategist.GetSheHeCap] will serve me well!
The Dragon Throne will not waste the talents of the Middle Kingdom's strategists on barbarians like [Root.GetTitledName].
I will not forget this!
Send a Scholar-Bureaucrat?

[FromFrom.GetTitledName] has sent an envoy asking for a scholar-bureaucrat as [FromFrom.GetSheHe] has earned enough Grace to request this Boon.\n\nRefusing the Boon without a good reason would be a widely unpopular move.
A scholar-bureaucrat will be sent!
The Dragon Throne does not acknowledge the envoy, for a good reason!
The Dragon Throne does not acknowledge the envoy, because I said so!
The Dragon Throne has dispatched [chinese_administrator.GetBestName] to serve you as a scholar-bureaucrat.
[chinese_administrator.GetSheHeCap] will serve me well!
The Dragon Throne will not waste the talents of the Middle Kingdom's scholar-bureaucrats on barbarians like [Root.GetTitledName].
I will not forget this!
Send a Master Engineer?

[FromFrom.GetTitledName] has sent an envoy asking for a master engineer as [FromFrom.GetSheHe] has earned enough Grace to request this Boon.\n\nRefusing the Boon without a good reason would be a widely unpopular move.
A master engineer will be sent!
The Dragon Throne does not acknowledge the envoy, for a good reason!
The Dragon Throne does not acknowledge the envoy, because I said so!
The Dragon Throne has dispatched [chinese_master_engineer.GetBestName] to serve you as a master engineer.
[chinese_master_engineer.GetSheHeCap] will serve me well!
The Dragon Throne will not waste the talents of the Middle Kingdom's master engineers on barbarians like [Root.GetTitledName].
I will not forget this!
Sign a Trade Contract?

[FromFrom.GetTitledName] has sent an envoy asking for a Chinese Trade Contract as [FromFrom.GetSheHe] has earned enough Grace to request this Boon.\n\nRefusing the Boon without a good reason would be a widely unpopular move.
Of course we will grant them this Boon!
The Dragon Throne does not acknowledge the envoy, for a good reason!
The Dragon Throne does not acknowledge the envoy, because I said so!

The Dragon Throne is in agreement. A Trade Contract has been signed between the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] and the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName], lasting for twenty-five years or until the [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] dynasty no longer sits on the Dragon Throne.
This will surely be a profitable agreement!
The Dragon Throne has no intention of agreeing to a Trade Contract with barbarians like [Root.GetTitledName].
I will not forget this!
An Imperial Marriage?

[FromFrom.GetTitledName] has sent an envoy asking for an Imperial Marriage between [FromFromFrom.GetBestName] and a Chinese princess of your choice as [FromFrom.GetSheHe] has earned enough Grace to request this Boon.\n\nRefusing the Boon without a good reason would be a widely unpopular move.
[dragon_bride_1.GetBestName] shall marry [FromFromFrom.GetBestName]!
[dragon_bride_2.GetBestName] will be sent!
[dragon_bride_3.GetBestName] is the perfect bride!!
Unfortunately, I have no princess to send...
[FromFromFrom.GetBestName] does not deserve an Imperial Marriage!
The Dragon Throne refuses, because I said so!

The Dragon Throne has agreed to an Imperial Marriage between [FromFromFromFrom.GetBestName] and [dragon_bride.GetFullName].\n\nIn addition to sending the bride-to-be, [From.GetTitledName] has agreed to a Peace Deal between the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] and the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName], lasting for fifty years or until the [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] dynasty no longer sits on the Dragon Throne.
May the union be fruitful!

The Dragon Throne is unfortunately unable to send an Imperial Princess to marry [FromFromFromFrom.GetBestName] at this time. [From.GetBestName] has, however, agreed to refund the Grace the request cost you, and will of course consider future Boon requests from you.
I suppose we could try again later...
The Dragon Throne will not send an Imperial Princess to marry a barbarian like [FromFromFromFrom.GetBestName], as he is unworthy of such an honor.
I will not forget this!
A New Concubine

[FromFromFrom.GetTitledName] has seen fit to grant you a new concubine, [From.GetBestName], who was sent to become an imperial concubine by [FromFrom.GetTitledName] but was deemed unworthy of the imperial court.
I suppose I could use another concubine...
A New Eunuch

[FromFromFrom.GetTitledName] has seen fit to grant you a new eunuch, [From.GetBestName], who was sent to become an imperial eunuch by [FromFrom.GetTitledName] but was deemed unworthy of the imperial court.
I suppose I could use another eunuch...
A New Commander

[FromFromFrom.GetTitledName] has seen fit to grant you a new commander, [From.GetBestName], who was sent to become an imperial commander by [FromFrom.GetTitledName] but was deemed unworthy of the imperial court.
I suppose I could use another commander
A New Physician

[FromFromFrom.GetTitledName] has seen fit to grant you a new physician, [From.GetBestName], who was sent to become an imperial physician by [FromFrom.GetTitledName] but was deemed unworthy of the imperial court.
I suppose I could use a physician...
A New Artifact

[From.GetTitledName] has seen fit to grant you an artifact, [tribute_artifact.GetBaseName], which was sent as a tribute by [FromFrom.GetTitledName] but was deemed unworthy of becoming part of the imperial collection.
I suppose I can find a use for it...

Your current Grace is [Root.grace.GetValue].

Grace is gained when pleasing the Dragon Throne, and lost if you displease the Dragon Throne, and can be spent to request Boons from the Dragon Throne, and any unspent Grace will be inherited by your primary heir.

However, should the current dynasty lose the Dragon Throne, all Grace is lost.
Good to know!

column1: # New desc as the former one was a bit weird if you could be given it. Non-English versions unaltered.

column2: Rumored to have belonged to a past Empress of China, perhaps even the renowned Wu Zetian herself, this masterfully crafted silk shroud shimmers in the light and draws the attention of all who see it.
column3: Réputé avoir appartenu à Wu Zetian, Impératrice de Chine, ce linceul en soie réalisé de main de maître chatoie et captive tous ceux qui l'aperçoivent.
column4: Gerüchten zufolge hat dieses meisterhaft gearbeitete Seidenkleid Wu Zetian, der Kaiserin von China gehört. Es schimmert im Licht und zieht die Aufmerksamkeit von allen an, die es sehen.
column6: Este velo de seda magistralmente confeccionado, del que se rumorea que perteneció a la famosa Wu Zetian, emperatriz de China, centellea a la luz y atrae la atención de todo el que lo ve.

This woman is a member of the extended Chinese Imperial Family and cannot marry normally.
Chinese Princess (married)
This woman is a member of the extended Chinese Imperial Family.
Chinese Tribute
This character has been sent to China as a Tribute and has therefore been barred from inheriting any titles.

Offer Gold for Grace
Offer [Root.GetTitledName] 500 gold as a tribute in exchange for Grace.\n\nThe amount of Grace depends on [Root.GetTitledName]'s traits.
Offer to Become Tributary

Offer to become a permanent tributary of the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] in exchange for a small amount of Grace now and a small amount of monthly Grace.\n\nThe amount of Grace depends on your religion and culture and the religion and culture of [Root.GetTitledName].
Offer Horses for Grace

Offer to supply the armies of the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] in exchange for a small amount of Grace now and a small amount of monthly Grace.\n\nThis will lower your manpower gain for as long as the treaty lasts.
Stop Supplying Horses

Stop supplying the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] with horses.

This will lower your Grace by a small amount but will remove the penalty to your manpower.

[Root.GetTitledName] is unlikely to accept an offer from you to supply horses for several years if you end the current agreement.
Offer Eunuch for Grace

Offer [Root.GetTitledName] one of your male courtiers as a eunuch.

You will gain a moderate amount of Grace if the tribute is accepted.

The amount of Grace depends on [Root.GetTitledName]'s traits, the traits of the eunuch, and whether he is deemed worthy of the imperial court.

The courtier offered to [Root.GetTitledName] will be castrated before the offer is made unless he already is a eunuch, and he is thus unlikely to think fondly of you.

If the tribute is accepted, the eunuch will be disinherited.
Offer Concubine for Grace

Offer [Root.GetTitledName] one of your female courtiers as a concubine.

You will gain a moderate amount of Grace if the tribute is accepted.

The amount of Grace depends on [Root.GetTitledName]'s traits, the traits of the concubine, and whether she is deemed worthy of the imperial court.

If the tribute is accepted, the concubine will be disinherited.
Offer Commander for Grace

Offer [Root.GetTitledName] one of your courtiers as a commander.

You will gain a moderate amount of Grace if the tribute is accepted.

The amount of Grace depends on [Root.GetTitledName]'s traits, the traits of the commander, and whether the commander is deemed worthy of the imperial court.

If the tribute is accepted, the commander will be disinherited.
Offer Physician for Grace

Offer [Root.GetTitledName] one of your courtiers as a physician.

You will gain a moderate amount of Grace if the tribute is accepted.

The amount of Grace depends on [Root.GetTitledName]'s traits, the traits of the physician, and whether the physician is deemed worthy of the imperial court.

If the tribute is accepted, the physician will be disinherited.
Offer to Send Relief for Grace

Offer to send [Root.GetTitledName] some relief in this time of need.

You will gain a large amount of Grace if the tribute is accepted.

The amount of Grace depends on [Root.GetTitledName]'s traits.
Offer Artifact for Grace

Offer [Root.GetTitledName] one of your artifacts in exchange for Grace.\n\nThe amount of Grace gained depends on [Root.GetTitledName]'s traits, the quality of the artifact, and whether the artifact is deemed worthy of being kept by the Dragon Throne.
Kowtow to China

Personally travel to the court of [Root.GetTitledName] to show your subservience.

This will cost you prestige depending on your tier, but will award you with some Grace.

The amount of Grace gained will depend on your actions at the court of [Root.GetTitledName].

This will result in a regency until you return.

A journey to China can be beneficial, particularly if [Root.GetTitledName] likes you, but might also be dangerous, particularly if [Root.GetTitledName] does not like you.
Request a Peace Deal

Request a Peace Deal with the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName], spending 250 Grace.

If this Boon is granted, you will not be able to declare war on the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName], nor the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] on you, for the next fifty years unless the dynasty on the Dragon Throne changes or either party breaks the agreement.

Unless you are or become a tributary of the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName], you will also be unable to declare war on their tributaries, while they will have no such restriction towards you.

The Grace spent will NOT be refunded if the Boon is refused.
Request a Physician
Request that [Root.GetTitledName] sends you a Chinese physician, spending 250 Grace.\n\nThe Grace spent will NOT be refunded if the Boon is refused.
Request an Artifact

Request that [Root.GetTitledName] sends you a Chinese artifact, spending 500 Grace.

The quality of the artifact you receive depends on whether you already own some Chinese artifacts and the traits of [Root.GetTitledName].

If you receive a high quality artifact, you will also gain some prestige.

The Grace spent will NOT be refunded if the Boon is refused.
Request a Siege Engineer
Request that [Root.GetTitledName] sends you a Chinese siege engineer, spending 750 Grace.\n\nThe Grace spent will NOT be refunded if the Boon is refused.
Request a Strategist
Request that [Root.GetTitledName] sends you a Chinese strategist, spending 750 Grace.\n\nThe Grace spent will NOT be refunded if the Boon is refused.
Request a Scholar-Bureaucrat
Request that [Root.GetTitledName] sends you a Scholar-Bureaucrat, spending 1000 Grace.\n\nThe Grace spent will NOT be refunded if the Boon is refused.
Request a Master Engineer
Request that [Root.GetTitledName] sends you a Chinese master engineer, spending 1000 Grace.\n\nThe Grace spent will NOT be refunded if the Boon is refused.
Request a Trade Contract

Request that the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] grants your merchants favourable status along the Silk Road, spending 2000 Grace.

If this Boon is granted, you will earn twice as much from the Silk Road for the next twenty-five years, unless the dynasty on the Dragon Throne changes.

Should you end up at war with the [Root.PrimaryTitle], or should you attack one of their tributaries without being one yourself, the Trade Contract will be revoked.

The Grace spent will NOT be refunded if the Boon is refused.
Request Imperial Marriage

Request that an unmarried male relative of yours (or you yourself, if you are male and unmarried) is granted a Chinese princess as a spouse, spending 1000 Grace (or 750, if you already have a Peace Deal).

[Root.GetTitledName] will get to choose a spouse for you among all eligible female relatives of [Root.GetHerHis], though the chosen bride is guaranteed to be of childbearing age and not maimed or ill.

If this Boon is granted, you will also sign a Peace Deal and will not be able to declare war on the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName], nor the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] on you, for the next fifty years unless the dynasty on the Dragon Throne changes or either party breaks the agreement.

Unless you are or become a tributary of the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName], you will also be unable to declare war on their tributaries, while they will have no such restriction towards you.

The Grace spent will NOT be refunded if the Boon is refused, but if there are no possible candidates to send the Grace will be refunded.
Check Grace
Check how much Grace you currently have to spend.
Revoke Peace Deal

Revoke your Peace Deal with the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName].

This will greatly anger [Root.GetTitledName] and make [Root.GetHerHim] unwilling to accept future Peace Deals with you.

If you rule China, this will have reprecussions on the Mandate of Heaven unless justfied.

If [Root.GetTitledName] rules China, this will cost you 5000 Grace regardless of whether it is justified or not.
